repnme.cdata!: Peru - Trade Policy Reform Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Trade Policy Reform Loan Project
            recognizes the major trade reform measures taken between
            August 1990 and September 1991 and comprises: (i) a
            reduction in tariff protection; (ii) the elimination of most
            non-tariff barriers; (iii) the elimination of export
            subsidies and improvement in schemes allowing exporters to
            recuperate indirect taxes; and (iv) the abolition of the
            agency which formerly administered trade control; reform of
            the customs functions; and passage of a legislative decree
            that raises many of the previously enacted trade reforms to
            the status of law. The sectoral conditions relate largely to
            the maintenance of the current reforms, and measures for
            futher reform are generally considered a secondary issues,
            except insofar as further action is felt necessary to secure
            the current reforms.
